intro: [WRONG START] Hosta fortunei f. Aurea, commonly known as the golden hosta, is a variegated form of the hosta plant. It features striking yellow-green foliage with broad, heart-shaped leaves that add visual interest to gardens. The plant is native to Asia and thrives in partial to full shade, making it ideal for woodland gardens. Its foliage remains attractive throughout the growing season, though it does not produce showy flowers. It is a low-maintenance plant that is well-suited for moist, well-drained soil.
